Nashville, TN 37205

citations.narrative:
The facility has not yet written a record which discloses the acquisition information for the rabbits obtained for this year's
exhibit. Records of acquisition are required to allow for tracing of the animals for medical and legal purposes. APHIS form
7020 may be used. The facility shall make, keep and maintain records which fully disclose the name, address, USDA
license number or drivers license number/state and vehicle plate number/state for the person from whom the animals
were obtained, along with the date of acquisition, the species and number of animals acquired. Correct by 3/26/24.

The facility does not currently have a written contingency plan available for review. A plan will help provide for the humane
handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their rabbits in the event of an emergency or disaster. APHIS
Form 7093 may be used. The facility must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide for care of the
animals during emergencies. Correct by 4/19/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility has not yet written a record which discloses the acquisition information for the rabbits obtained for this year's 
exhibit. Records of acquisition are required to allow for tracing of the animals for medical and legal purposes. APHIS form 
7020 may be used. The facility shall make, keep and maintain records which fully disclose the name, address, USDA 
license number or drivers license number/state and vehicle plate number/state for the person from whom the animals 
were obtained, along with the date of acquisition, the species and number of animals acquired. Correct by 3/26/24. 
2.134(a) 
   
Contingency planning. 
The facility does not currently have a written contingency plan available for review. A plan will help provide for the humane 
handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their rabbits in the event of an emergency or disaster. APHIS 
Form 7093 may be used. The facility must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide for care of the 
animals during emergencies. Correct by 4/19/24. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
